The awesomeness of an array is the number of blocks of consecutive identical numbers.

Note: The initial approach in the code uses a global variable `ans` and an `update` function.

The total awesomeness over all contiguous subarrays can be computed by considering the contribution of each adjacent pair.

How does a block boundary at position i (between a[i] and a[i+1]) contribute?
- Any contiguous subarray that includes both a[i] and a[i+1] will have a block boundary at this position. 
- The number of contiguous subarrays that include both a[i] and a[i+1] is (i+1) * (n - i - 1).

  total = (number of contiguous subarrays) + (number of boundaries in each subarray)
